Class BallFrame.Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • BallFrame.Ball
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Enclosing class:
    BallFrame

    private class BallFrame.Ball
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The ball class is an extension of the JPanel that extends the Runnable interface. It holds a velocity and location for the x and y coordinates relate to it's parent frame, and initializes a color to be used in it's paintComponent(Graphics) override. It also stores VELOCITY_VARIATION in order to vary it's direction when colliding with a border of the frame.
    See Also:
    JPanel, Runnable, paintComponent(Graphics), VELOCITY_VARIATION

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        Ball()
        constructor to set the dimensions of the BallFrame.Ball to their default size of 80px. It also nullifies their layout in order to use Component.setBounds(int, int, int, int) to move the panel across the frame. It's movement is detailed in run(), where it's location is updated during thread execution.
        See Also:
        BallFrame.Ball, Component.setBounds(int, int, int, int), run()

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The method override to draw a new circle with width and height of 75. It also configures antialiasing for smoother movement.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object to be rendered in the JPanel constructor.

      • run

        public void run()
        The run() method required from the Runnable interface is executed once a thread is started. The function runs continuously and updates the stored corX and corY values before using Component.setBounds(int, int, int, int) )} to update the components new location in the frame. corX and corY are advanced by their velocity, unless a collision is detected, which results in a call to switchX() or switchY() in order to keep the balls in frame at all time, and alter their velocity by a small factor, creating a unique random path.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        See Also:
        Runnable, Component.setBounds(int, int, int, int), switchY(), switchX()

      • switchX

        private void switchX()
        The switchX method flips the velocity in the opposite direction so that BallFrame.Ball objects move away from border collisions. It also adds a small randomized shift in velocity so that paths are randomized.
        See Also:
        BallFrame.Ball, VELOCITY_VARIATION

      • switchY

        private void switchY()
        The switchX method flips the velocity in the opposite direction so that BallFrame.Ball objects move away from border collisions. It also adds a small randomized shift in velocity so that paths are randomized.
        See Also:
        BallFrame.Ball, VELOCITY_VARIATION
